definitions.example: Loops and conditional statements are constructs in computer programming.
Bohr's theoretical construct of the atom was soon superseded by quantum mechanics.

definitions.definition: (genetics) A segment of nucleic acid, created artificially, for transplantation into a target cell or tissue.
To build or form (something) by assembling parts.
definitions.example: We constructed the radio from spares.

definitions.definition: To build (a sentence, an argument, etc.) by arranging words or ideas.
definitions.example: A sentence may be constructed with a subject, verb and object.

definitions.definition: To draw (a geometric figure) by following precise specifications and using geometric tools and techniques.
definitions.example: Construct a circle that touches each vertex of the given triangle.
